content: Weiyi Meng's Home page Weiyi Meng SUNY Distinguished Service Professor School of Computing Room P08, Engineering Building Phone: (607) 777-4311 Watson College of Engineering and Applied Science Binghamton University Binghamton, NY 13902 Email: meng@binghamton.edu Weiyi Meng is a SUNY Distinguished Service Professor. He was the director (previously chair) of the School of Computing (formerly known as Department of Computer Science) at Binghamton University from August 2016 to August 2025. He served as an Associate Dean for Research and Graduate Studies of the Thomas J. Watson College of Engineering and Applied Science from August 2014 to June 2016. He received his Ph.D. in computer science from University of Illinois at Chicago in 1992 and joined the School as a faculty member in the same year. His research interests include metasearch engines, Web database integration, Internet-based information retrieval, Web data quality, Web information extraction, sentiment analysis, and database management systems. He has done pioneering work in large-scale metasearch engines. He is the co-author of three books (Principles of Database Query Processing for Advanced Applications, Advanced Metasearch Engine Technology and Deep Web Query Interface Understanding and Integration). He has published over 150 papers and many of them in top conferences and journals in his research areas, including ACM SIGMOD, VLDB, IEEE ICDE, WWW, KDD, ACM SIGIR, ACM TODS, ACM TOIS, ACM TWEB, and IEEE TKDE. His publications have been cited more than 9,500 times according to Google Scholar and his H-Index is 48. He is recognized as a top computer scientist in the United States (Research.com). He has served as a member of the program/organizing committees of more than 100 international conferences, as a conference/program committee chair for some of them. He has also served on the editorial boards of several journals.
